title: Andy Dick pleads not guilty to sexual battery charge of groping his Lyft driver
text:
CLOSE Placido Domingo accused of sexual misconduct; Andy Dick allegedly assaulted; Alanis Morissette gives birth to her third child. AP

Andy Dick has pleaded not guilty to a misdemeanor count of sexual battery for allegedly groping his Lyft driver, his attorney Daniel Kapelovitz confirmed to USA TODAY.

The alleged groping incident took place in West Hollywood, Calif., on April 12, 2018, according to a press release from the Los Angeles District Attorney's Office.

The comedian, 53, was arraigned Friday in Los Angeles Superior Court and faces up to 180 days in county jail if convicted, the release says.

Kapelovitz called the allegations against his client "completely baseless."

"Our understanding was that the District Attorney realized that this case had no merit, and that is why the case was never filed," he said in a statement to USA TODAY Friday. "Then, almost a year and a half later, we learn from TMZ that there was an outstanding warrant based on a misdemeanor complaint filed just prior to the statute of limitations running out. This case should be dismissed outright. If not, we look forward to fighting these false accusations."

Kapelovitz added Dick's next court date is set for a pretrial hearing on Nov. 4.

More: Comedian Andy Dick says he was attacked, left unconscious in New Orleans

Andy Dick has been charged with groping a driver from a ride-hailing service. Los Angeles County prosecutors say he is expected to be arraigned Friday, Oct. 4, 2019, on a charge of misdemeanor sexual battery. (Photo: Evan Agostini, Evan Agostini/Invision/AP)

Dick has been arrested and sued over several other groping accusations through the years, including a 2010 incident involving a bouncer and patron at a West Virginia bar.

Criminal charges were dismissed after Dick completed a pretrial diversion program.

More: Andy Dick charged with groping woman on Los Angeles street

In June 2018, the entertainer was accused of groping a woman on a Los Angeles street, landing him misdemeanor sexual battery and battery charges. Days later, videos resurfaced of the actor rubbing Ivanka Trump’s legs during an episode of "Jimmy Kimmel Live" in 2007 and fondling Pamela Anderson's breasts during a 2005 Comedy Central roast.

More: Andy Dick gropes Pamela Anderson's breasts, Ivanka Trump's leg in resurfaced, decade-old clips

Andy Dick attends The Comedy Central Roast of James Franco at Culver Studios on August 25, 2013 in Culver City, California. (Photo: Jason Merritt, Getty Images for Comedy Central)

In October 2017, in wake of Hollywood producer Harvey Weinstein's fall and the rise of the #MeToo movement, Dick was fired from his role in the film "Raising Buchanan" following claims of sexual harassment and misconduct on set, he confirmed in an interview to The Hollywood Reporter.

According to THR, Dick was accused of "groping people’s genitals, unwanted kissing/licking and sexual propositions of at least four members of the production."

"I don't grope people anymore. I don't expose myself anymore," he told The Hollywood Reporter by telephone. "I do understand that the temperature in the world right now is delicate."
